content: Is Cargo sensitive to this kind of thing as well? https://www.bleepingcomputer.com/news/security/researcher-hacks-over-35-tech-firms-in-novel-supply-chain-attack/

crates.io won't allow uploading if regular or build dependencies are not already on crates.io. dev dependencies can be missing I think, but those won't be built for dependencies except in case of things like crater.
In any case even if crates.io were to allow uploading it, it would simply be impossible to build it. Cargo requires all dependencies to be found.
Ah, it was also discussed on reddit: https://www.reddit.com/r/rust/comments/lgl7bf/is_cargo_vulnerable_to_this_supplychain_attack/

The users forum has more information on using cargo config to replace the default crates.io source: Dependency confusion attack â€” may be applicable to alternative registries.

This may help prevent accidentally using crates.io.
